name: Nyla “Nyx” Rourke
description: Beat alchemist headlining warehouse sets until dawn.
hook: Her sampler occasionally plays a track no one loaded — a voice counting down in an unknown language.

name: Mateo Serrano
description: Runs a beloved late-night taco cart by the river.
hook: Strangers keep paying with coins that are warm to the touch and vanish by morning.

name: Zadie Noor
description: Keeps the neon-lit counter calm when things turn weird.
hook: Fills a recurring prescription for a patient declared deceased last year.

name: Dax Hollow
description: Bombs rooftops and films drone fly-throughs at 3 a.m.
hook: His latest mural paints itself when no one is watching — changing nightly.

name: Bianca Volkov
description: Curates impossible guest lists and secret venues.
hook: Gets texts from a future event she hasn’t announced — with security warnings.

name: Jordan Kincaid
description: Discrete driver for VIPs and the very unlucky.
hook: His GPS adds a fifth basement level to certain hotels after midnight.

name: Sloane Ito
description: Mixes perfection with a skyline view.
hook: The bar mirror shows patrons missing from the room — who arrive minutes later.

name: Bishop Kane
description: Stoic door guardian who rarely needs to raise his voice.
hook: His clicker tallies more guests than physically enter — always the same extra number.

name: Lila Petrov
description: Velvet-voiced singer with a devoted midnight crowd.
hook: Her closing song makes the room’s clocks stop until the final note.

name: Ray “Switch” Delgado
description: Threading traffic like a ghost through headlights.
hook: Keeps getting runs to buildings that were condemned years ago.

name: Mina Farrow
description: Voice in the darkness taking calls that no one should take.
hook: Caller ID flashes her own number during on-air confessions.

name: Tariq Haddad
description: Sells coffee, smokes, and quiet advice at 4 a.m.
hook: Security cam shows customers that never triggered the door chime.

name: Cassie Luo
description: Turns dive nights into legends with perfect cue timing.
hook: A mysterious track appears in the queue that compels duets from strangers.

name: Viktor Dima
description: Owns the night on elevated expressways.
hook: Challenged by a driver in a model that went out of production in 1969 — plate unregistered.

name: Greta Kozlov
description: Repairs ripped suits and bloody cuffs without questions.
hook: Finds identical gray dust in every pocket — it clings to needles like iron filings.

name: Theo Marchand
description: Hunts neon reflections and empty intersections.
hook: Long-exposures reveal people walking where the street was demolished years ago.

name: Raven Cortez
description: Scouts skylines for live VJ feeds.
hook: Her drone’s altimeter reports ‘negative height’ above a certain alley.

name: Quinn Marlowe
description: Summons parties in forgotten places with a single post.
hook: Coordinates keep arriving for sites that don’t exist on city maps — yet crowds find them anyway.

name: Jiro Watanabe
description: Blade dancer serving perfection from a stall under the overpass.
hook: Occasionally fillets a fish with bones arranged like letters spelling customers’ names.

name: Serena Bell
description: Routes chaos with a clipped tone and perfect memory.
hook: Gets distress calls timestamped ten minutes in the future — sometimes she prevents them.

name: Pavel Moroz
description: Human metronome of the revolving door on midnight shifts.
hook: Greets a guest every night who never crosses the threshold but leaves wet footprints inside.

name: Tegan Rowe
description: Specializes in intricate linework in an unlisted basement studio.
hook: A client’s ink re-arranged overnight to form a map that leads beneath the river.

name: Dante Vega
description: Freelances out of neon laundromats and dim gaming cafés.
hook: Found an admin account named after him active since before he was born.

name: Yolanda Cruz
description: Cleans up the mess the city pretends not to see.
hook: Mops up footprints that lead up the walls and across the ceiling — only after last call.

name: Felix Arroyo
description: Inspects venues for permits no one bothered to apply for.
hook: Keeps citing a theater that burned down in 1911 — the citation prints freshly every month.
